intro: Agoseris gracilenta, commonly known as slenderleaf agoseris, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It produces small, yellow to brown flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Agoseris gracilenta is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in full sun conditions.
